1. Minutes of the January 23, 2023 City Council Meeting
RESULT:
YEAS:
ABSENT:


ACCEPTED [8-0-1]
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui
Councillor Nolan

PAGE 1

Feb 13, 2023

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the Final Landmark
Designation Report for the Maria Baldwin-Alvaro Blodgett Houses.
CMA 2023 #30
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan

RESULT:

Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan

3. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appointment of Erin
Muirhead McCarty to the Community Benefits Advisory Committee for a term of three years.
CMA 2023 #32
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan

4. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of the
Mass Save Community First Partnership Grant in the amount of $150,000, to the Grant Fund
Community Development Department Other Ordinary Maintenance Account, these funds, received
through a community partnership with the Eversource Energy Services Company, will contribute to
meeting the City’s energy efficiency outreach and engagement goals.
CMA 2023 #33
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan


PAGE 2

Feb 13, 2023

5. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Policy Order 2023 #7,
regarding Information on Blier, et al., Zoning Petition. FINAL FEBRUARY 13, 2023
CMA 2023 #34
RESULT:
REFERRED TO THE PETITION
FINAL FEBRUARY 13, 2023
[8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan

6. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
$222,684.00 funded by the Massachusetts Executive Office of Elder Affairs to the Grant Fund
Department of Human Service Programs Salary and Wages account ($122,792.00), to the Grant Fund
Department of Human Service Programs Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($85,892.00), and to
the Grant Fund Department of Human Service Programs Travel and Training account ($14,000.00),
funds are used to provide funding for department staff and services. Funds also support instructors
and group facilitators who provide services virtually to seniors.
CMA 2023 #35
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan

7. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of the
Adult and Community Learning Services grant received from the Massachusetts Department of
Elementary and Secondary Education (DESE) in the amount of $39,071.00 to the Grant Fund Human
Service Programs Salary and Wages account ($38,492.00) and to the Grant Fund Human Service
Programs Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($579.00), which will be used to pay for prep time for
part time teachers and for staff to participate in the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion professional
series pilot from DESE.
CMA 2023 #36
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan


PAGE 3

Feb 13, 2023

8. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of a
donation from Global Oil for the Fuel Assistance Program in the amount of $1,643.39 to Grant Fund
Human Service Programs Other Ordinary Maintenance account, which will be used to provide oil
deliveries for fuel assistance clients who have exhausted their benefits or for over-income clients that
fall in the 60-80% of AMI.
CMA 2023 #37
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan

9. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of the
Community Learning Center (CLC) grant in the amount of $38,000.00 to the Grant Fund Human
Service Programs Salary and Wages account ($30,420.00), to the Grant Fund Human Service
Programs Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($5,042.00), and to the Grant Fund Human Service
Programs Travel and Training account ($2,538.00). The funds represent a grant from the Jacobs
Foundation. They are providing support for Bridge Program advising, coaching and mentoring,
advising for the ESOL/Certified Nursing Assistant Program, and education and career advising for
other CLC students.
CMA 2023 #38
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan

10. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of the
Community Learning Center (CLC) grant in the amount of $36,000.00 to the Grant Fund Human
Service Programs Salary and Wages account ($26,805.00), to the Grant Fund Human Service
Programs Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($7,571.00), and to the Grant Fund Human Service
Programs Travel and Training account ($1,624.00), which will be used to fund the classes, advising
and coaching of the Bridge to College Program students from July 2022 through June 2023.
CMA 2023 #39
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan


PAGE 4

Feb 13, 2023

11. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of the
Accelerating Climate Resilience Grant in the amount of $100,000 received from the Metropolitan
Area Planning Council (MAPC) to the Grant Fund Public Celebrations (Arts and Culture) Other
Ordinary Maintenance account, which will be used to commission artists to design temporary shade
pavilions for city parks or other public facilities.
CMA 2023 #40
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:

Councillor Nolan

14. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to a request for approval to
seek authorization from the Massachusetts Office of the Inspector General (the “IG”) for the City to
use the Construction Manager at Risk (“CMaR”) procurement and construction method (the “CMaR
Method”) in connection with Renovation of City Offices at 689 Massachusetts Avenue project.

ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

PAGE 6

Feb 13, 2023

18. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
$200,000 from the General Fund Electrical Department Salary and Wages account to the General
Fund Electrical Other Ordinary Maintenance account. The funds will be used to support the
Department’s core functions such as the purchase of services, where appropriate, to support core
functions of maintaining street lighting, municipal fire alarms, lighting in parks, municipal buildings,
and emergency call boxes as well as infrastructure upgrades and maintenance activities.
CMA 2023 #47
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan

19. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of a
Recycling Dividends Program Grant, received from, the Massachusetts Department of Environmental
Protection (DEP) in the amount of $110,500, to the Grant Fund Public Works Other Ordinary
Maintenance account, these funds will be used for various City recycling programs including
purchasing compost and recycle carts, conducting a waste characterization and increasing education
on recycling
CMA 2023 #48
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Nolan

Number PO 2023 #28, regarding a legal opinion on the Doug Brown petition.

PAGE 7

Feb 13, 2023

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. That the City Manager is requested to instruct the Community Development Department to draft
amendments to the proposed BEUDO language to change the net zero deadline from 2050 to
2035 and to propose language to meet that deadline throughout the document (From the April 20,
2022 Ordinance Committee).
POR 2023 #14
Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [5-4-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

NAYS:
Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toner

2. That the City Manager is requested to look into the feasibility of automated traffic enforcement in
Cambridge as well as using unarmed CPD traffic details for future discussion
Automated/Unarmed Traffic Enforcement.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TONER
IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 6, 2023
PLACED ON THE TABLE BY COUNCILLOR AZEEM
IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 13, 2023
POR 2023 #19
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
PLACED ON THE TABLE

Next: 2/27/2023 5:30 PM

3. That City Council rescind the vote to refer the Brown Petition to the Ordinance Committee and
Planning Board for hearing because the petition is defective as a matter of law.
POR 2023 #27
Vice Mayor Mallon
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [7-2-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Mayor Siddiqui

NAYS:
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 8

Feb 13, 2023

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
4. That the Ordinance Committee refer Categories M (Shared Vehicle) and N (Publicly-accessible,
Privately-owned Electric Vehicle Charging System) of the Cambridge Transportation
Decarbonization and Congestion Mitigation Bill, along with definitions, to the full City Council
with a favorable recommendation. Ordinance #2022-13 as Amended
EXPIRED ON SEPTEMBER 27, 2022
POR 2022 #150
Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 2/27/2023 5:30 PM

5. An Ordinance has been received from Diane P. LeBlanc City Clerk, relative to Emissions
Accounting Zoning Petition (Ordinance #2022-20)
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL DECEMBER 19, 2022
TO BE ORDAINED ON OR AFTER JANUARY 9, 2023
EXPIRES ON MARCH 6, 2023
ORD 2022 # 20
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 2/27/2023 5:30 PM

6. The Ordinance Committee met on November 14, 2019 to continue discussions on the petition by
Stephen R. Karp, Trustee of CambridgeSide Galleria Associates Trust, to amend the Zoning
Ordinance of the City of Cambridge by adding a Section 13.100 that creates a new PUD-8
District.
RESULT:
ACCEPTED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Nolan,
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Vice Mayor Mallon


PAGE 9

Feb 13, 2023

7.
Ordinance The Ordinance Committee met on April 20, 2022, to continue the public hearing on
proposed amendments to the Building Energy Use Disclosure Ordinance (Ordinance #2021-26)
The Committee voted favorably to ask the City Manager to instruct the Community Development
Department to draft amendments to the proposed BEUDO language to change the net zero deadline from
2050 to 2035 and to propose language to meet that deadline throughout the document. This appears on
this agenda as a Policy Order.

Excerpt from the Transcript
CITY CLERK ANTHONY WILSON: Mr. Chair, I just want to again read this to make sure that
this is recorded correctly. So Councillor Nolan's motion is to instruct CDD -- oops, to ask the
City Manager to instruct the Community Development Department to draft amendments to the
proposed BEUDO language to change the net zero deadline from 2050 to 2035 and to propose
language to meet that deadline throughout the document. Is that correct?
COUNCILLOR QUINTON Y. ZONDERVAN: Perfect.
COUNCILLOR PATRICIA M. NOLAN: Yes. Thank you.
CITY CLERK ANTHONY WILSON: On that motion.
City Clerk Anthony Wilson called the roll:
Councillor Burhan Azeem - Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone - Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Absent
Councillor Marc C. McGovern - Absent
Councillor Patricia M. Nolan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Councillor E. Denis Simmons – Absent
Councillor Paul F. Toner – Absent
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Yes-5, No-0, Absent-4. Motion Passed
RESULT:
ACCEPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

8. An Ordinance has been received from Diane P. LeBlanc City Clerk, relative to Ordinance 2022-2
Chapter 2.02 entitled “City Council”.
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 6, 2023
TO BE ORDAINED ON OR AFTER FEBRUARY 27, 2023
ORD 2022 # 2
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 10

Next: 2/27/2023 5:30 PM

Feb 13, 2023

Section 22.80 Flood Resilience Standards
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 6, 2023
TO BE ORDAINED ON OR AFTER FEBRUARY 27, 2023
EXPIRES APRIL 26, 2023
ORD 2022 # 9
RESULT:

Next: 2/27/2023 5:30 PM

Feb 13, 2023

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. An application was received from MIT Lit Visual Arts Center requesting permission for a (35) thirty
five temporary banners Ames Street, Memorial Drive to Main Street, Ames Street, Main Street to
Broadway, Boradway, Ames Street to Third Street, Third Street, Broadway to Main Street, Main
Street, Third Street to Broadway announcing MIT Visual Arts Center and Contemporary Art from
February 2023 through March 2024.
APP 2023 #8
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 12

Feb 13, 2023

PAGE 41

Feb 13, 2023

V. RESOLUTIONS
1. Resolution on the death of Camille M. "Cammy" Fournier.
Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2023 #56
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. Resolution on the death of Edna Dorothy Powers.
Councillor Toner, Councillor McGovern and entire membership.

23-9.

(O-10) from 2/6/2023

23-10.

Report on engaging with community groups and the City’s existing multi-member
bodies to design the next iteration of the Cambridge Community Electricity
Aggregation program.
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Mallon
(O-11) from 2/6/2023

23-11.

Report on reviewing the current state of mental health resources, particularly for
underserved communities, within the Cambridge Health Alliance.
(O-12) from 2/6/2023

23-12.

Report on options of how to increase overnight resident street parking in the vicinity
of Rogers Street.
Councillor Zondervan (O-13) from 2/6/2023

Jan 23, 2023

Packet Pg. 56

1

MINUTES OF THE CAMBRIDGE CITY COUNCIL
REGULAR MEETING

A regular meeting of the Cambridge City Council was held on Monday, January 23, 2023. The
meeting was called to order at 5:30 p.m. by the Honorable Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui. Pursuant to
Chapter 20 of the Acts of 2022 adopted by Massachusetts General Assembly and approved by
the Governor, this public meeting was hybrid, allowing participation in person, in the Sullivan
Chamber, 2nd Floor, City Hall, 795 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge, MA and by remote
participation via zoom.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui called the meeting to order and asked the Clerk to call the roll.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Remote
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Present/In Sullivan Chamber
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Present/In Sullivan Chamber
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Present/In Sullivan Chamber
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Present/In Sullivan Chamber
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Remote
Councillor Paul Toner – Present/In Sullivan Chamber
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Present/In Sullivan Chamber
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Present/In Sullivan Chamber
Present-9. Quorum established.
Mayor Siddiqui led the Council in the Pledge of Allegiance and called for a moment of
silence.
PUBLIC COMMENT
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized individuals for public comment. The following
individuals participated in the public comment portion of the meeting, each being allowed
up to 2 minutes to speak:
Catherine Zusy, 202 Hamilton Street, Cambridge, MA, from the Advisory Board for Valentine
Art House, spoke in favor of the City purchasing Peter Valentine’s house.
Gabriel Cira, 189 Hamilton Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of restoring Peter Valentine’s
house. They also commented that providing affordable housing for artist to help the space of
Central Square would be beneficial.
Helen Snively, 1 Fayette Park, Cambridge, MA, commented that restoring Peter Valentine’s
house will help bring the community together and provide healing and joy.
Catherine LeBlanc, 14 Tufts Street, Cambridge, MA, shared they supported Policy Order #4, and
that green space is important for Cambridgeport and Central Square.
1
Packet Pg. 57

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Jan 23, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

Monday, January 23, 2023

1

Nancy Berliner, 545 Franklin Street, Cambridge, MA, from the Museum of Fine Arts, Ross
Miller read for Nancy Berliner and Michael J. Bramwell, sharing that Peter Valentine’s house is
a landmark of creativity in the Cambridge community. By preserving the house and environment
will demonstrate expression and leadership in Cambridge.

Lydia Eccles, 63 Allston Street, Cambridge, MA, shared that if anyone would be at a Council
meeting to speak on a creative center to develop culture in Cambridge it would be Peter
Valentine.
Shannon Flattery, 6493 Dominguez Lane, Santa Fe, NM, from the Touchable Stories Inc/The
Bobby Mendes Peace Legacy, read an expert from an interview they did with Peter in 1998.
John Goodman, 8 Fairmont Avenue, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of Policy Order #4 and
shared Cambridge is strong because it encourages new ideas and welcomes creativity.
Dan Marshall, 41 Second Street, Cambridge, MA, from Cambridge Community Center for the
Arts, spoke in favor of POR 2023 #11 and ask the City to continue Peter Valentine’s legacy.
Shelley Rieman, 201 Franklin Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of PO #4 and offered
suggestions on how the City could move forward with it.
E.J. Barnes, 18 Chalk Street, Cambridge, MA, noted it would be important to maintain the
property whether it was for affordable housing or an arts space, to help the unhoused and
creative people.
Catherine Carr Kelly, 450 Massachusetts Avenue, Cambridge, MA, from the Central Square
Theater, spoke on CMA #15 and requested support from the City for arts and culture, and a free
summer arts festival.
Young Kim, 17 Norris Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of Policy Order #4 and echoed
comments from other public speakers regarding using the house towards affordable housing or
an art space.
Margery Davies, 35 William Street, Cambridge, MA, from Mother’s Out Front, spoke in favor of
the Council adopting the Net Zero Specialized Stretch Code.
Marilee Meyer, 10 Dana Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of Peter Valentine’s house and
is against leaf blowers for street cleaning because it’s against an ordinance. They also spoke on
the stretch code and climate resilience zoning.
Ross Miller, 19 Perry Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of Policy Order #4 and thanked
Peter Valentine for bringing conversation to his family with his artwork.
Cathy Hoffman, 67 Pleasant Street, Cambridge, MA, offered comments on usage of Peter
Valentine’s house.

2
Packet Pg. 58

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Jan 23, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

Vivek Sikri, 64 Allston Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of Policy Order #4 and shared
that maintaining the property will be beneficial for the cultural district and community.

1

Ron Mallis, 567 Tremont Street, Boston, MA, from Boston APP/Lab, spoke in favor of the City
purchasing Peter Valentine’s house and using it as a community space.
Rabbi Yoni, spoke in favor of using the Valentine house for low-income housing and keeping an
artistic idea to it. They also spoke in favor of the Duane Callendar petition.

Gary Mello, 324 Franklin Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke on Policy Order #4 and affordable
housing.
Adria Katz, 109 Cushing Street, Cambridge, MA, from the Multicultural Arts Center, spoke on
Peter Valentine’s house and making it a studio focused space and community arts resource.
David Rabkin, 184 Huron Avenue, Cambridge, MA, from Cambridge Climate Committee, spoke
on APP 2023 #4 and asked that the specialized stretch code be adopted.
Suzanne Blier, 5 Fuller Place, Cambridge, MA, shared support for acting on Peter Valentine’s
house and was not in favor stopping to tow cars during street cleaning. They also offered
comments on the specialized stretch code.
James Williamson, Churchill Avenue, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of adding apartments for
artists in Peter Valentine’s house. They also spoke on the planning of Terminal Road.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Nolan who made a motion to close
public comment.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – No
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-8, No-1, Motion Passed.
SUBMISSION OF THE RECORD
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor McGovern who made a motion to accept
and place on file the minutes of the City Council Regular Meeting on December 19, 2022.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
3
Packet Pg. 59

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Jan 23, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

Heather Hoffman, 213 Hurley Street, Cambridge, MA, spoke in favor of the proposal for a bench
in memory of Rich McKinnon and in favor of keeping the arts in Cambridge. They also spoke on
the Callendar petition and zoning.

1

Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-9. Motion Passed.
Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Jan 23, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

A group of protesters in the Sullivan Chamber, disrupted the City Council meeting.

The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to recess.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-9. Motion Passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to come out of recess at approximately 7:08
p.m. and continue the meeting via zoom.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Present/Remote
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Present/Remote
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Present/Remote
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Present/Remote
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Present/Remote
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Present/Remote
Councillor Paul Toner – Absent
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Absent
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Present/Remote
Present-7, Absent-2. Quorum established.
CITY MANAGER’S AGENDA
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to accept and place on file CMA 2023 #17
relative to the appointment of individuals to the Cambridge Cemetery Master Plan
Advisory Committee, and to refer CMA 2023 #20 relative to Climate Resilience Zoning to
the Petition.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.

of $500,000.

and place CMA 2023 #15 on file.

recognized and recognized Councillor Azeem, Councillor Toner and Councillor Nolan to
also speak on the matter.

1

The Chair Pro Temp, Vice Mayor Mallon recognized Councillor Toner on CMA 2023 #18
relative to Policy Order #312 regarding the feasibility of conducting street cleaning without
towing. Several members of City Manager Huang’s team were present to answer questions on
this matter including Commissioner Kathy Watkins, Deputy City Manager Owen O’Riordan and
City Solicitor Nancy Glowa.
Councillor Toner made a motion to suspend the rules to bring forward his late filed Policy
Order, POR 2023 #12, copy attached.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes

Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Absent
Yes-8. Absent-1. Motion Passed.
Councillor Toner expressed his concern with the CMA and spoke on his new Policy Order. The
Chair Pro Temp, Vice Mayor Mallon recognized Councillor Carlone who spoke on the CMA
expressing his concern.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Zondervan who exercised his Charter
Right on late filed POR 2023 #12.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Nolan, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Azeem and Vice Mayor Mallon who spoke in support of CMA 2023 #18
and asked questions. The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui also recognized Councillor Toner, Councillor
Simmons, and Councillor Carlone for comments and questions.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to place CMA 2023 #18 on file.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – No

Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes

The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Carlone on CMA 2023 #19 relative to
the appropriation of $390,000 to be used for the design of a transportation connection
between Terminal Road and Wheeler Street. Councillor Carlone made remarks and thanked
all involved for their work. The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui also recognized Councillor Nolan and
Councillor Zondervan on the matter.

comments.

the order for APP 2023 #4, 17 Fresh Pond Parkway.

Council adopt the Specialized Stretch Code with an effective date of July 1, 2023. City
Manager Huang and members of his team including Deputy City Manager O’Riordan, Assistant
City Manager Farooq, and City Solicitor Glowa were present to answer questions. Councillor
Toner spoke stressing the need for community outreach around this matter.

suspend the rules and bring forward his late filed COF 2023 #17.

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Jan 23, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

1

The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor McGovern on POR 2023 #8, regarding a
request that the Law Department opine on questions related to the Duane Callender, et al.
Cambridge Lab Regulation Zoning Petition.
Councillor McGovern made a motion to suspend the rules to bring forward Committee
Report # 6 regarding the Ordinance Committee public hearing held on January 4, 2023, on
the questions related to the Duane Callender, et al. Cambridge Lab Regulation Zoning
Petition.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-9. Motion Passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor McGovern who noted that POR 2023 #8 came
out of the meeting held on January 4, 2023. He also noted that at that same meeting, the
Committee voted favorably to send the Petition to the Full Council with a recommendation that it
be sent to the Economic Development and University Relations Committee and the Long Term
Planning, Public Facilities, Arts and Celebrations Committee.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor McGovern who made a motion to adopt POR
2023 # 8, and to refer the Duane Callender, et al. Cambridge Lab Regulation Zoning Petition to
the Economic Development and University Relations Committee and the Long Term Planning,
Public Facilities, Arts and Celebrations Committee, and to accept Committee Report #6 and
place it on file.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-9. Motion Passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Simmons on POR 2023 #10 relative to
special permitting fees and bicycle parking requirements that are required of local
recreational cannabis dispensaries. The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui also recognized Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Azeem and Councillor Nolan who spoke on the matter.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Vice Mayor Mallon who made a motion to amend

11
Packet Pg. 67

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Jan 23, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)

1

POR 2023 #10 by adding the words “the need for a special permitting process for cannabis
dispensaries” and “ the special permit process, and” so that the Policy Order reads:
ORDERED: That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to direct the appropriate City
personnel to explore the need for a special permitting process for cannabis dispensaries,
special permitting fees and bicycle parking requirements that are required of local recreational
cannabis dispensaries, to provide a report on how the special permit process, and these
requirements may impact these businesses, to determine whether these requirements may need to
be modified or eliminated, and to report back to the City Council on this matter in a timely
manner.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-9. Motion Passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui made a motion to adopt POR 2023 #10 as amended.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
Vice Mayor Alanna M. Mallon – Yes
Councillor Marc C. McGovern – Yes
Councillor Patricia Nolan – Yes
Councillor E. Denise Simmons – Yes
Councillor Paul Toner – Yes
Councillor Quinton Y. Zondervan – Yes
Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui – Yes
Yes-9. Motion Passed.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Simmons on POR 2023 #11 relative to
the feasibility of purchasing the property located at 37 Brookline Street, former home of
Peter Valentine, with the intent of utilizing this as a community space. The Chair, Mayor
Siddiqui recognized Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Azeem, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor
Toner, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, and Councillor McGovern to speak on the matter.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui also spoke on the matter.
The Chair, Mayor Siddiqui recognized Councillor Simmons who made a motion to adopt
POR 2023 #11.
City Clerk LeBlanc called the roll.
Councillor Burhan Azeem – Yes
Councillor Dennis J. Carlone – Yes
12
Packet Pg. 68

Minutes Acceptance: Minutes of Jan 23, 2023 5:30 PM (Submission of the Record)
